metadata.title: CVE-2022-4900 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in PHP where setting the environment variablePHP_CLI_SERVER_WORKERS to a large value leads to a heap buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17
php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17
php8.1-bcmath - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.17').
